com.diffplug.common.rx

Interface RxTracingPolicy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RxTracingPolicy.LogSubscriptionTrace

    public interface RxTracingPolicy
    Plugin which gets notified of every call to Rx.subscribe, allowing various kinds of tracing.

    By default, no tracing is done. To enable tracing, do one of the following:

    • Execute this at the very beginning of your application: DurianPlugins.set(RxTracingPolicy.class, new MyTracingPolicy());
    • Set this system property: durian.plugins.com.diffplug.common.rx.RxTracingPolicy=fully.qualified.name.to.MyTracingPolicy
    RxTracingPolicy.LogSubscriptionTrace is a useful tracing policy for debugging errors within callbacks.
    See Also:
    DurianPlugins

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RxTracingPolicy.LogSubscriptionTrace
      An RxTracingPolicy which logs the stack trace of every subscription, so that it can decorate any exceptions with the stack trace at the time they were subscribed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RxTracingPolicy NONE
      An RxTracingPolicy which performs no tracing, and has very low overhead.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Field Detail

      • NONE

        static final RxTracingPolicy NONE
        An RxTracingPolicy which performs no tracing, and has very low overhead.

    • Method Detail

      • hook

        <T> Rx<T> hook(Object observable,
               Rx<T> listener)
        Given an observable, and an Rx which is about to be subscribed to this observable, return a (possibly instrumented) Rx.
        Parameters:
        observable - The IObservable, Observable, or ListenableFuture which is about to be subscribed to.
        listener - The Rx which is about to be subscribed.
        Returns:
        An Rx which may (or may not) be instrumented. To ensure that the program's behavior is not changed, implementors should ensure that all method calls are delegated unchanged to the original listener eventually.
